授業目的: This course is designed to help students understand the fundamentals of formal debate.
到達目標:
At the end of this course, students will be able to do the following:
1. Clearly state an opinion
2. Coherently explain an opinion
3. Support an opinion
4. Organize an opinion into a speech
5. Refute an opinion
6. Challenge an opposing opinion
7. Debate an opinion
This course will also help students to become more mature, confident public speakers. When learning to debate, students will also develop their skills in speaking, listening, writing, reading, researching, critical thinking, discussing, collaborative learning, and much more.
授業方法:
[Online Course]
Lectures will be given to introduce the fundamentals of debate. Students will then work on assignments that will help them practice and review each major part of a formal debate. Audio-visual materials will be presented to students in preparation for their own final debates.

第1回:
Course Introduction
Introduction to Formal Debate
Misconceptions about Second Language Debate
第4回:
Understanding Formal Debate Formats
Writing the First Affirmative Constructive Speech
第7回: Organizing the First Negative Constructive Speech
第10回:
Putting It All Together
Choosing Final Debate Topics
第11回: Judging and Flowing a Full Debate
第12回: Researching and Preparing for Final Debates
